title: Charlie Kirk memorial: Trump arrives inside stadium to cheers as tens of thousands attend service - latest updates
summary: The US president is set to speak at an event in Glendale, Arizona, which will also feature notable right-wing commentators such as Steve Bannon and Elon Musk. The gathering highlights the increasing influence of these figures in the political landscape. Their attendance signifies a potential alignment of ideas and supporters within the right-wing community.

title: Trump joins thousands at memorial for rightwing activist Charlie Kirk
summary: White House adviser Stephen Miller referred to an activist killed in Utah as "immortal," highlighting the lasting impact of his work. He expressed that the activist's legacy will inspire millions to continue his mission. Miller's remarks underscore the activist's significance within the movement for social change.

title: Morning Mail: Australia recognises Palestinian state; why Sydney has the most fare evaders; Olyslagers wins high jump gold
summary: Australia has made a significant shift in foreign policy by recognizing Palestine as a state. Meanwhile, Sydney faces challenges with the highest fare evasion rates in the country. In sports, an Australian high jumper secured a gold medal at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: Mikel Arteta is allowed to learn, but time wonâ€™t wait for him | Barney Ronay
summary: The manager waited until the second half, when his team was trailing by a goal, before adopting an aggressive strategy against Manchester City. This tactical shift aimed to improve their chances of scoring. Prior to this, the approach was more cautious and defensive.

title: Latest recognitions of Palestinian state will deepen global diplomatic rifts
summary: Israel has warned of retaliatory annexations in the West Bank amidst rising tensions. Concurrently, the UK, Canada, and Australia have made announcements that have escalated discord with the US. This situation highlights the growing geopolitical complexities in the region.
